request_pathways.name: Center for Sight Medical Information Release Form
Write to EyeSouth Partners Privacy Officer

access_pathway.primary_pathway_description: Patients must locate an affiliate practice's website and download a generic authorization form; the parent organization provides no patient-facing records request process.

red_flags: Indefinite authorization with no expiration date on primary form
Georgia Retina form charges flat $25 fee without distinguishing patient access from third-party release
Georgia Retina form asks for reason for release, which HIPAA does not require for patient access
Georgia Retina form last updated 2016, predating Right of Access Initiative and Cures Act
bright_spots: Patient-friendly closing language on primary form
Both forms are concise single-page documents

findability.rationale: Level 2: Forms required persistence and creative search strategies — parent org has no patient-facing content; forms found only by identifying and searching individual affiliate practice websites.

technical_accessibility.rationale: Level 3: Form has a text layer but zero fillable fields requiring print-and-handwrite completion; fax submission is available via listed fax numbers, providing an electronic submission pathway.

content_design.rationale: Level 3: Primary form is adequately organized with plain language and logical flow, but lacks instructions, offers no record-type checkboxes, and has no scope or format options — a patient can complete it but would benefit from more guidance.

patient_centeredness.rationale: Level 2: Patient self-access is not addressed — the parent org provides no patient pathway, and both affiliate forms are generic authorization forms with no distinction between patient access rights and third-party release.

compliance.rationale: Level 3: Primary form has an indefinite authorization with no expiration; Georgia Retina form imposes a flat $25 fee and asks for a reason for release — requirements that may go beyond what HIPAA permits for patient access requests.

overall.summary: EyeSouth Partners provides a fragmented, affiliate-dependent records access experience with generic authorization forms that don't recognize patient self-access as a distinct use case.
